Your sleep on the voyage home is fraught with nightmares. Upon returning to Arkham, you and the others bring the expedition's findings back to an elated Tillinghast. As you relay the events of the expedition to the collector, he turns each piece in hand, marveling at the ancient technology. "You've done all I asked and more," he grins. "Consider your debts annulled. And, of course, I'm more than happy to honor our original agreement."

Your sleep on the voyage home is fraught with nightmares. Upon returning to Arkham, you and the others lay your few findings before Tillinghast. The antiquarian is furious when he sees you returned empty handed until Andy lays the obsidian slab he found in R'lyeh on his desk. Randall surveys it with a cold stare. "I suppose this isâ€¦ adequate. Consider your debts annulled. And, despite the fact that you have brought almost nothing of value, I am obliged to honor our original agreement."
For each progress you have marked on your task, you (and only you) gain 1 additional experience point.

steps.title: Walk in Faith
steps.text: If there are 5 or more progress marked under your Task:

Upon returning, you are hailed as a prophet amongst your fellow believers. The dreams that led you to R'lyeh are the same visions shared by your brothers and sisters in the faith. Now, more and more of them are singing in strange tongues and stitching patchwork cloaks. Your purpose in traveling to R'lyeh, in witnessing those lost pilgrims, was not to shake your faith, but to restore it. You have glimpsed the face of the ancients. Only you are fit to lead your people out of darkness and into the light. You need only continue to follow your path with the same unshakeable devotion that delivered you from R'lyeh.

You stand on a bridge overlooking the Miskatonic River, watching the waters below dance and glimmer. Upon returning, you felt something was different. Something changed. Your fellow believers say that outsiders wearing patchwork cloaks recently arrived, uttering miraculous prophecies and enticing promises. Now your place of worship is covered in profane symbols: a hand with a flaming eye; a chalice overflowing with blood. What you once thought holy was ruined.
Now, as you stand overlooking the water, you hold your token of faith in one hand. You cannot help but feel that you were led astray. Taking a deep breath, you throw the token into the water below. As it sinks, you feel some part of yourself sink with it. There is no turning back now.

Permanently remove the "Walk in Faith" Task from your deck and suffer 1 mental trauma. For the remainder of the campaign, you must treat the [elder_thing] token as if it were an [auto_fail] token, instead.

steps.title: Good Money
steps.text: If there are 5 or more progress marked under your Task:

Smirking, you walk away from your rendezvous with Sanford with a briefcase stuffed with bills. You skimmed enough ancient knick knacks and research notes to satisfy both Tillinghast and that old bat Sanford. With the payout from each of them, you have enough cash to go wherever you want, to be whomever you want to be. It sounds like Sanford and his lackeys are going under anyway.

Smirking, you walk away from your rendezvous with Sanford with a full briefcase. You turn a corner to find yourself surrounded by thugs.
"Tillinghast told us you were well overdue. Thankfully, I think you're ready to pay up," one of them says. Apparently, it was tougher to play both sides than you thought. Raising your fists, you brace yourself for what's about to come next. Hell, if you're going down, you're gonna go down swinging.

Permanently remove the "Good Money" Task from your deck and suffer 1 physical trauma. Search the collection for an [[Injury]] or [[Criminal]] basic weakness and add it to your deck. This card does not count toward your investigator's deck size.

You leaf through Randall's reward for all your efforts: a tattered stack of Blavatsky and Crowley books. They might satisfy some fledgling seer, but not you. The fact that he offered them as a reward is almost insulting. Closing the book, you hear a faint whisper of the same voices you heard in R'lyeh. Your nightmares were not heralds of destruction: they were warnings from vagrant spirits. The coming calamity may be unavoidable, they tell you, but that doesn't mean you can't fight it.

The whispers that plagued you in R'lyeh have finally stopped. Since returning from R'lyeh, you wake up every morning to complete silence. Rather than console you, however, the lack of whispers fills you with even more dread. It is as if your link to the beyond has been severed. Or perhaps the spirits that wanted to warn you of the coming calamity have abandoned you.
Permanently remove the "Dreams of Destruction" Task from your deck and suffer 1 mental trauma.

steps.title: No Place Like Home
steps.text: If there are 5 or more progress marked under your Task:

You storm out of Tillinghast Esoterica, your head ringing with Randall's honeyed promises. Your debt was forgiven, but there is still the matter of your room and board to settle. "Just a few more months, and we can finally settle up," he cooed. Rather than answer, you grabbed your reward and walked out. It was never about the money. He wanted to keep you on retainer. He'll surely be after you for the money eventually, but that doesn't matter now. You never needed him in the first place. Home is what you make it, not where you make it, there's nothing Tillinghast can do to take that from you now.

You walk through Southside, reflecting on Randall's last words to you. Your debt was forgiven, but there is still the matter of your room and board to settle. "Just a few more months, and we can finally settle up," he cooed. You thanked him. It's an entirely reasonable request. And after all, he's the only reason you're not living on the streets.
Walking past Ma's Boarding House, you catch the scent of a home-cooked meal: fresh-baked bread, green beans, and sliced ham. Your stomach rumbles. You feel an old yearning, something more than hunger. Just a lttle more work, and Tillinghast will help you get your feet under you. Someday soon, you'll have a home of your own.
Permanently remove the "No Place Like Home" Task from your deck and suffer 1 physical or 1 mental trauma.

steps.title: Do No Harm
steps.text: If there are 5 or more progress marked under your Task:

Walking through Independence Square, you round a corner to see a figure slumped on the ground. You break into a sprint toward them as your mind floods with memories of the pilgrim in R'lyeh. Your stomach turns as you approach, hoping for a much less gruesome experience. She's still breathing. You can help her. Whatever trouble people find themselves in, you know you'll always be there to help.

steps.text: You wake up suddenly in the middle of your first night back in Arkham. The cat perched on the end of your bed flees in surprise as you wipe cold sweat from your forehead. Echoes of the faces you left behind slowly fade, but you can't stop thinking about the dying man's last words: "Mother." Your heartbeat slows as you stare out the window. Thoughts of what you could have done differently envelop you. You will never be able to save everyone. Is it even worth it to try?
Permanently remove the "Do No Harm" Task from your deck and suffer 1 mental trauma.

steps.title: Toe the Line
steps.text: If there are 5 or more progress marked under your Task:

"You'll be in charge of overseeing the construction and eventual management of the new factory." Your new employer beams, sliding a crisp contract across the table. As you look out the window of your new office, you feel your heart swell. After your success with the expedition, Tillinghast mentioned his connections with the budding New Horizons Industries. Even though the meat-packing magnate has yet to break ground in Arkham, Randall has assured you that you will be well taken care of. All you need to do is sign on the dotted line.

The room goes silent when you enter. When you asked for your old job back, Tillinghast was more than happy to oblige. As your old supervisor chats away like you never left, you catch your old colleagues' nervous stares. Whatever small favors the shady businessman pulled must have worked. As you take your seat, you look out at the nervous colleagues you once called friends. You got everything you wanted, even your old desk. Why do you still feel so empty?
Permanently remove the "Toe the Line" Task from your deck and suffer 1 physical trauma.

steps.title: Prove Your Worth
steps.text: If there are 5 or more progress marked under your Task:

It is several nights after your return to Arkham, and you are looking down on an adoring crowd. It's no surprise the expedition was a success. It's all because of you. And after promising Tillinghast a few paltry favors, you're getting the recognition you so richly deserve. Soon, you'll see to it that anyone who ever doubted you gets what they deserve, as well. Whoever said humility was a good thing?

On the night of your return, you find yourself ignominiously shut out of your old crowd. Tillinghast himself spread the worst kinds of rumors about you. What's worse is that they were all true. You were nothing but a burden on the expedition. You are the laughing stock of your circle. Nothing you've achieved was ever on your own merits. You're as worthless as they said you are.

Permanently remove the "Prove Your Worth" Task from your deck and suffer 1 mental trauma. Remove cards of level 1-5 from your deck worth a total of 10 or more experience (remember to purchase new cards to maintain a legal deck size). You cannot purchase those cards again.

steps.title: Plumb the Depths
steps.text: If there are 5 or more progress marked under your Task:

Barely a week after returning, you receive a request from Miskatonic University to formally present your findings. The word 'tenure' has reached your ears more than once. Despite the incredible acclaim your studies have brought you, the prestige feels empty. The academic song and dance is little more than shadowplay. And it is nothing compared to the horrific truths you learned in R'lyeh. On more than one occasion, you find yourself awake in the dark, breathing heavily, with memories of a time and a world not your own. You know the horrible truth: Humanity is nothing more than a weak echo of far greater civilizations.
Perhaps it is true. Perhaps you are nothing but a speck, and all your strivings are for naught. But you've also heard great things about Miskatonic's tenure package. You've earned it, damn it all. You may as well enjoy it.

It is several nights after your return, and you are sitting in one of the many reading rooms in Miskatoni's Orne Library, staring at a roaring fire. Your findings were received as mere fantasy, and the ancient writings you translated were dismissed out of hand. You would be lucky to teach children, let alone lecture in the grand halls of a university. You pause your reading to look at a strange codex scrawled in the margins of your book, strangely familiar. For a moment, you feel a famihar pang of curiosity, the same as you felt in R'lyeh.
You close the textbook. If no one will listen to you, why bother?
Permanently remove the "Plumb the Depths" Task from your deck and suffer 1 mental trauma.
